alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 30 at 6:51PM HST until January 30 at 8:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... At 651 PM HST, radar indicated that heavy rain had ended over Kauai. However, runoff from earlier heavy rainfall continues, and Kuhio Highway near Hanalei is closed due to flooding. A river gage near the Hanalei Bridge indicates water levels are still rising, but the decrease in rainfall should lead to lowering water levels soon. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Princeville, Kilauea, Hanalei, Wainiha, Haena, Na Pali State Park and Kalihiwai. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
